Name: Roope Pöyry
aboutMeContent: Skilled Software Developer with 7 years of experience. I have developed multiple services from scratch to customers' needs and modernized older systems. I master multiple technologies and adopt new ones easily. I enjoy solving various kinds of challenges in my work.

content.EasyOpp:
Designing and developing ERP software in a product development team. Two of our main applications include mobile PWA which is used by employees of our customers to log, edit and view their work-hours and related information. And a Desktop web app which includes e.g. approving work-hours, transfering salaries to integration and other administrative features like configuration of work-hour and salary calculation.

I had the main responsibility when we implemented the new mobile UI (ReactJS + TypeScript) from scratch. Creating a base to start building the application, implementing core features and generic components as well as reviewing other people's work. I also did the infrastructure setup for Azure deployment.

I've also had the responsibility to be designing the renewal of our salary calculation process including the underlying data model improvements and how the process could be made easier for the user and how these two aspects would integrate together.

As a Senior Developer I have had the opportunity to mentor Junior Developers to share my knowledge and help them with different aspects of their work from which I have gotten positive feedback.

The main technologies in use are React + TypeScript, C# + .NET, MSSQL and Azure. I have also done some maintenance for existing E2E tests using Robot Framework with Playwright.
content.Adalia:
Designing and developing web applications both in customer projects in different industries and developing our own Monitoring and Evaluation system.

I had the chance to start the implementation of a completely new system to replace the old one for one customer. Creating the application structure (React + Rails), designing data model and implementing user and permission management to provide basis for other people to join development.

For one of our customer projects I implemented offline functionalities to allow the data to be saved whilst the user is offline and synchronization to the server once the user had the network connection again. I also did my master's thesis on this specific subject which included some additional research on the subject such as using service workers to cache application content in the browser.

Starting as Junior Developer my responsibilities grew over my time at Adalia meaning I would also get to mentor new Junior Developers who joined after me. This also meant that for some projects I was the sole developer responsible for maintenance and had multiple projects at the same time.

Mostly used technologies were Ruby on Rails, React and PostgreSQL. I also did configurations for services to be run on AWS Fargate and AWS Lambda and worked on a Node.js API.
content.Other: Additionally I have prior work experience e.g. as Prison Guard, Storage Worker and School Assistant.

content.React: I have multiple years of experience of working with React UIs both with TypeScript and JavaScript. I have designed and implemented several React apps from scratch which has allowed me to try and learn new things about React along the way. I have used React in my personal projects as well such as this website and converted a React PWA to Android app and published it at the Play Store.
content..NET: I have worked with C# + .NET backends over a year now at EasyOpp. Currently using mainly .NET 8 and Entity Framework Core in our APIs. Additionally I have also worked with SignalR for sending real-time messages to our React UI from our API. For Unit tests we have been using NUnit framework.
content.Rails: I have 6 years of experience of maintaining and developing Rails applications both with existing systems and completely new projects. I have had the responsibility to design and implement application architecture, data model, user and permission management etc.
content.Azure: Currently all our apps are hosted in Azure and deployments are configured using Bicep scripts. I have done the setup for our new mobile frontend which is run as an App Service.
content.AWS: I have experience of setting up containers to be run in AWS Fargate and configuring load balancers for these services. I have also setup API Gateways using Ruby on Jets to deploy the application code to be run in AWS Lambda.
